different.description:
Definition: Let NPDA $M = (Q, \Sigma, \Gamma, \delta, q_0, Z, \emptyset)$.
The last two symbols in this definition mean that the stack is initialized to $Z$ (as usual for a PDA), and the set of final states is the empty set.
Then, $M$ accepts $L(M)$ by Empty Stack acceptance if
$L(M) = \{w \in \Sigma^*\ |\ (q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$.
different.question: Look carefully at the parameter set of $M$. What is different?
correctFeedback: There are no final states, so this is defined to be the empty set: $\emptyset$.

p.description:
Definition: Let NPDA $M = (Q, \Sigma, \Gamma, \delta, q_0, Z, \emptyset)$.
The last two symbols in this definition mean that the stack is initialized to $Z$ (as usual for a PDA), and the set of final states is the empty set.
Then, $M$ accepts $L(M)$ by Empty Stack acceptance if
$L(M) = \{w \in \Sigma^*\ |\ (q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$.
p.question: To understand $(q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$, what does it mean that $q_0$ changed to $p$?
p.answer: The machine moved from the start state to state $p$.
choices: The machine moved from the start state to state $p$.
The string is consumed by the machine.
The stack contents are consumed by the machine.

pfinal.description:
Definition: Let NPDA $M = (Q, \Sigma, \Gamma, \delta, q_0, Z, \emptyset)$.
The last two symbols in this definition mean that the stack is initialized to $Z$ (as usual for a PDA), and the set of final states is the empty set.
Then, $M$ accepts $L(M)$ by Empty Stack acceptance if
$L(M) = \{w \in \Sigma^*\ |\ (q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$.
pfinal.question: Is $p$ a final state?
pfinal.answer: No, we do not have a final state in this type of acceptance
choices: No, we do not have a final state in this type of acceptance

w.description:
Definition: Let NPDA $M = (Q, \Sigma, \Gamma, \delta, q_0, Z, \emptyset)$.
The last two symbols in this definition mean that the stack is initialized to $Z$ (as usual for a PDA), and the set of final states is the empty set.
Then, $M$ accepts $L(M)$ by Empty Stack acceptance if
$L(M) = \{w \in \Sigma^*\ |\ (q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$.
w.question: To understand $(q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$, what does it mean that $w$ changed to $\lambda$?
w.answer: The string is consumed by the machine.
choices: The machine moved from the start state to state $p$.
The string is consumed by the machine.
The stack contents are consumed by the machine.

Z.description:
Definition: Let NPDA $M = (Q, \Sigma, \Gamma, \delta, q_0, Z, \emptyset)$.
The last two symbols in this definition mean that the stack is initialized to $Z$ (as usual for a PDA), and the set of final states is the empty set.
Then, $M$ accepts $L(M)$ by Empty Stack acceptance if
$L(M) = \{w \in \Sigma^*\ |\ (q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$.
Z.question: To understand $(q_0, w, Z) \stackrel{*}{\vdash} (p, \lambda, \lambda)\}$, what does it mean that $Z$ changed to $\lambda$?
Z.answer: The stack contents are consumed by the machine.
choices: The machine moved from the start state to state $p$.
The string is consumed by the machine.
The stack contents are consumed by the machine.

language.question: What is the language represented by the PDA?

a1machine.description:
Example}: $L = \{a^nb^mc^{n+m}\ |\ n, m > 0\}$, $\Sigma = \{a, b, c\}$, $\Gamma =\{0, Z\}$.
Let us trace processing the string $aabccc$.
a1machine.question: Based on the top of the stack and the highlighted input symbol, what will happen to the machine?

aabcccend.description:
Example}: $L = \{a^nb^mc^{n+m}\ |\ n, m > 0\}$, $\Sigma = \{a, b, c\}$, $\Gamma =\{0, Z\}$.
Let us trace processing the string $aabccc$.
aabcccend.question: Based on the top of the stack and the fact that we are at the end of the string, what will happen to the machine?

aabcccstack.description:
Example}: $L = \{a^nb^mc^{n+m}\ |\ n, m > 0\}$, $\Sigma = \{a, b, c\}$, $\Gamma =\{0, Z\}$.
Let us trace processing the string $aabccc$.
aabcccstack.question: Based on the top of the stack and the fact that we are at the end of the string, what will happen to the stack?
correctFeedback: In this case, popping the top pops $Z$ off the stack.

accept.description:
Example}: $L = \{a^nb^mc^{n+m}\ |\ n, m > 0\}$, $\Sigma = \{a, b, c\}$, $\Gamma =\{0, Z\}$.
Let us trace processing the string $aabccc$.
accept.question: Will the string be accepted?
accept.answer: Yes, the machine ends with an empty stack
choices: Yes, the machine ends with an empty stack
No, the machine ends in a non-final state

aabcaccept.description:
Example}: $L = \{a^nb^mc^{n+m}\ |\ n, m > 0\}$, $\Sigma = \{a, b, c\}$, $\Gamma =\{0, Z\}$.
Let us trace processing the string $aabc$.
aabcaccept.question: Should string $aabc$ be accepted?
aabcaccept.answer: No, it is not in the language
choices: No, it is not in the language

reject.description:
Example}: $L = \{a^nb^mc^{n+m}\ |\ n, m > 0\}$, $\Sigma = \{a, b, c\}$, $\Gamma =\{0, Z\}$.
Let us trace processing the string $aabc$.
reject.question: Will the string be accepted?
reject.answer: No, the machine is finished all steps and ended with a non-empty stack
choices: No, the machine is finished all steps and ended with a non-empty stack
